title: News for Sasquatch at the Summit.

items.title: Reverted Chronograf to version 1.9.4
items.content_text: Reverted Chronograf to version 1.9.4 due to the annoying ':' bug in the query editor.

items.title: Chronograf updated to version 1.10.1
items.content_text: See release notes in the link above for changes since 1.9.4

items.title: Summit EFD data is now being automatically replicated to USDF
items.content_text: As of March 10th, Summit EFD data is being automatically replicated to USDF. Previous data is still being restored manually. See SQR-034 for details on how to access the data.

items.title: Sasquatch is the new home for the Summit EFD database!
items.content_text: We have migrated the Summit EFD database to the Sasquatch service on the RSP cluster (yagan).

items.title: Chronograf 1.9.4
items.content_text: Upgrade Chronograf to the latest release.

items.title: Chronograf 1.9.3
items.content_text: Upgrade Chronograf to the latest release.

items.title: EFD time scale is now UTC
items.content_text: According to RFC-767 we are switching the EFD time scale from TAI to UTC. This means that when you query the EFD via Chronograf or the EFD client the timestamps for the InfluxDB time column are returned in UTC. So you can use functions like now() in your InfluxQL queries safely, and manipulate time using Flux without worring about the time shift between TAI and UTC. The column private_sndStamp still has the timestamp values in TAI in case you need to work with them. This change affects telemetry recorded after 2021-10-13 21:46:57 UTC at the Summit EFD.

items.title: Chronograf 1.9.1
items.content_text: This version fixes three issues in Chronograf reported by us (yay!) #5784: Fix Safari display issues of a Single Stat, #5796: Avoid useless browser history change, and #5803: Repair time rendering in horizontal table.

items.title: Chronograf display issues with Safari
items.content_text: We have seen issues rendering Tables and Single Stat panels on dashboard cells with recent versions of Safari. We recommend using Chrome for a better experience.

items.title: Custom auto-refresh intervals
items.content_text: In Chronograf 1.9.0 we can now configure custom auto-refresh intervals for dashboards. We added the option to refresh dashboard contents every 1s. However, use this feature with caution if your dashboard has too many cells or if you are querying data on large time ranges.

items.title: Chronograf 1.9.0
items.content_text: Chronograf 1.9.0 brings a number of new features and improvements, see blog post linked above for more information.
